text:
Hi community, I'd like to tell you about a rather unusual problem. It involves a page built with Hubl, featuring dynamic content. Everything was fine for years. The page has been online for, well, years and worked perfectly. That is, until yesterday.

Starting yesterday, something odd began happening. The HTML being rendered is incorrect and behaving strangely. After thoroughly checking everything, I concluded it had nothing to do with the code itself. The code is the same as it's always been.

Then I discovered something surprising. I raised a ticket with HubSpot but haven't received a response yet.

1/ When I view the page in preview mode, it looks perfect and works fine. However, the published page looks wrong.

2/ If I add the flag 'hsDebug=true' to the URL of the problematic page, it starts displaying correctly again.

This makes me think there's something cached (stored) in some way that's causing the incorrect display of the page's content. To me, it seems like HS might have cached something related to the Hubl code processing. It's very strange.

Has anyone else experienced something like this? Can anyone share some insights or tips on how to solve this?

Yea, bugs like this happens really often, usually the process is:
• I try to bust cache 10+ times, republish the page multiple times, nothing changes
• I open a ticket with screenshot and description of the problem
• HubSpot doesn't understand and ask for more info
• When I take a look magically the page return functioning 
We seriously need a button in settings that bust the whole website cache completely
Yes, I'm still waiting for this problem to magically resolve itself, and I mean there's nothing I can think of to do, should I republish the page a few more times while I wait for support?
You can try it, in my case it never resolved the issue

hey! i’m trying to add an email address from a HubDB table into a custom form for the notifications override. my code looks like this {% form “team_member_form” label=“Team Member Form”, form_to_use=“12345”, notifications_are_overridden=True, notifications_override_email_addresses=“{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.email }}” %} i’ve seen that they sunset notifications to non-users, so I’ve set up user accounts for testing. i’m not getting the form notification so i’m assuming my code is wrong. any ideas?

For individual pages => I cloned the page,  Unpublish the live page and publish the cloned page with the same URL and it works for me,

Not sure about the dynamic pages!

I'm hoping someone in the community can help me with this.
I want to pass parameters via a link in an email to display information on a HubSpot landing page.
The information is present for the contact in HubSpot but the user has not been cookied.
So I'd like to pass the info dynamically through the link in the email that leads to the HubSpot landing page so that the required information is displayed on the landing page.

I tried using this but it didn't work:
<https://web.yardsworth.com/yardswworth-valuation?firstname={{contact.firstname}}&address={{contact.address}}&preliminary_offer={{contact.preliminary_offer}}|https://web.yardsworth.com/yardswworth-valuation?firstname={{contact.firstname}}&addre[…]t.address}}&preliminary_offer={{contact.preliminary_offer}}>

I presume you were trying to get the name up in the Hi :wave:
Thanks for requesting a Yardsworth™
section? What’s teh hubl code rendering that?

I'm trying to get all of that information. The address and our preliminary offer. I was able to accomplish it using
{{ request.query_dict.firstname }} on the landing page.

The only issue with that is I do have some people that visit that page (that are cookied) and they access that page via a link that does not pass all of those parameters over.

My workaround, for now, is to just duplicate my landing page and use {{ request.query_dict.firstname }} and send all my known non-cookied people the email with the link containing the url parameters.

I'd love a way to not have to do that though :slightly_smiling_face:

Here is the URL that is dynamically created in the email for a user. That goes to the duplicated landing page using the dictionary variable.

<https://web.yardsworth.com/yardswworth-valuation-update-1?firstname=Tonathiu%20&address=1220%20West%20Ivyton%20Street&yardsworth=$82,450>
it’s odd that the appraisal value seems about 2x what’s in the url
Just kidding. But you know some end user is going to do that, and get the support people wrapped around the axle…

I am trying to move a module around from one {% widget_container %} to another {% widget_container %}, the issue we are encounter is when we go to move module, you cannot just move it around freely, you have to add another module to the `widget_container` before you can  freely move modules around, here is my code:

`<div class="tabPanel" data-panelname="tab2" aria-labelledby="tab2" >`
            `{% widget_container "Tab 2 Section" overrideable=True, per_widget_wrapper_html='', wrapping_html='', label='Nav Section 2' %}`
                `{% end_widget_container %}`
        `</div>`

        `<div class="tabPanel" data-panelname="tab3" aria-labelledby="tab3" >`
            `{% widget_container "Tab 3 Section" overrideable=True, per_widget_wrapper_html='', wrapping_html='', label='Nav Section 3' %}`
                `{% end_widget_container %}`
        `</div>`

        `<div class="tabPanel" data-panelname="tab4"  aria-labelledby="tab4" >`
            `{% widget_container "Tab 4" overrideable=True, per_widget_wrapper_html='', wrapping_html='', label='Nav Section 4' %}`
                `{% end_widget_container %}`
        `</div>`

        `<div class="tabPanel" data-panelname="tab5"  aria-labelledby="tab5" >`
            `{% widget_container "Tab 5" overrideable=True, per_widget_wrapper_html='', wrapping_html='', label='Nav Section 5' %}`    
                `{% end_widget_container %}`
        `</div>`
